revised_title: The Ginger-beer Plant and Its Organisms: A Contribution to the Study of Fermentation-Yeasts and Bacteria
tldr: The author investigates the "ginger-beer plant," a compound organism found in home-made ginger beer fermentations. They discover that it consists of a symbiotic association of a specific Saccharomycete and a Schizomycete, along with other yeasts, bacteria, and mold-fungi. The author separates and examines these organisms, studying their growth, development, and interactions in various environments.
